S4.T1.caption: Table 1: Prediction results compared with “upper-bound” and “lower-bound”, respectively. The accuracy is reported in the averaged accuracy. A​c​cg​l​o​b​a​l𝐴𝑐subscript𝑐𝑔𝑙𝑜𝑏𝑎𝑙Acc_{global} (%) denotes the averaged accuracy across all participated devices, and A​c​cl​o​c​a​l𝐴𝑐subscript𝑐𝑙𝑜𝑐𝑎𝑙Acc_{local} (%) denotes the global accuracy. The upper-bound is set as the performance of FedAvg in a totally I.I.D. data setting, and the lower-bound is set as the performance of FedAvg in the generated extreme Non-I.I.D. data setting.
references:
The comparison of three benchmark datasets is demonstrated in Table 1 and Table 2.
Specifically, Table 1 compares the proposed Fed-FSNet with the defined upper-bound and lower-bound, respectively. It can be observed from the results that our method surpasses the lower-bound by a significant margin in the extreme Non-I.I.D. data setting. The global accuracy and averaged local accuracy of the proposed Fed-FSNet achieve 88.2% / 85.3%, 61.7% / 60.4%, and 66.4% / 64.1% for MNIST [66], CIFAR-10 [68], and Fashion-MNIST [67] when f=1.0, respectively.
Table 2 compares the proposed Fed-FSNet with selected representative FL methods in fully Non-I.I.D. (f=0.1) setting. We can observe that our method constantly obtains the best performance for global accuracy and averaged local accuracy, respectively.

S4.T2.caption: Table 2: Prediction Results compared with representative models in Non-I.I.D. (f=0.1) setting. The accuracy is reported in the averaged accuracy. A​c​cg​l​o​b​a​l𝐴𝑐subscript𝑐𝑔𝑙𝑜𝑏𝑎𝑙Acc_{global} (%) denotes the averaged accuracy across all participated devices, and A​c​cl​o​c​a​l𝐴𝑐subscript𝑐𝑙𝑜𝑐𝑎𝑙Acc_{local} (%) denotes the global accuracy.
references:
The comparison of three benchmark datasets is demonstrated in Table 1 and Table 2.
Specifically, Table 1 compares the proposed Fed-FSNet with the defined upper-bound and lower-bound, respectively. It can be observed from the results that our method surpasses the lower-bound by a significant margin in the extreme Non-I.I.D. data setting. The global accuracy and averaged local accuracy of the proposed Fed-FSNet achieve 88.2% / 85.3%, 61.7% / 60.4%, and 66.4% / 64.1% for MNIST [66], CIFAR-10 [68], and Fashion-MNIST [67] when f=1.0, respectively.
Table 2 compares the proposed Fed-FSNet with selected representative FL methods in fully Non-I.I.D. (f=0.1) setting. We can observe that our method constantly obtains the best performance for global accuracy and averaged local accuracy, respectively.
